example.para: This example creates a capacity provider that uses the specified Auto Scaling group MyASG and has managed scaling and manager termination protection enabled.

code.title: To create a capacity provider

example.para: This example creates a cluster in your default region.

code.title: To create a new cluster

example.para: This example creates a service in your default region called ``ecs-simple-service``. The service uses the ``hello_world`` task definition and it maintains 10 copies of that task.

code.title: To create a new service

example.para: This example creates a service in your default region called ``ecs-simple-service-elb``. The service uses the ``ecs-demo`` task definition and it maintains 10 copies of that task. You must reference an existing load balancer in the same region by its name.

code.title: To create a new service behind a load balancer

example.para: This example creates a task set in a service that uses the EXTERNAL deployment controller.

code.title: To create a task set

example.para: This example deletes the account setting for your user for the specified resource type.

code.title: To delete your account setting

example.para: This example deletes the account setting for a specific IAM user or IAM role for the specified resource type. Only the root user can view or modify the account settings for another user.

code.title: To delete the account settings for a specific IAM user or IAM role

example.para: This example deletes an attribute named stack from a container instance.

code.title: To delete a custom attribute from an Amazon ECS instance

example.para: This example deletes a specified capacity provider.

code.title: To delete a specified capacity provider

example.para: This example deletes an empty cluster in your default region.

code.title: To delete an empty cluster

example.para: This example deletes the my-http-service service. The service must have a desired count and running count of 0 before you can delete it.

code.title: To delete a service

example.para: This example deletes a specified deregistered task definition.

code.title: To delete a task definition that has been deregistered

example.para: This example deletes a task set and uses the force flag to force deletion if it hasn't scaled to zero.

code.title: To delete a task set within a service that uses the EXTERNAL deployment controller type

example.para: This example deregisters a container instance from the specified cluster in your default region. If there are still tasks running on the container instance, you must either stop those tasks before deregistering, or use the force option.

code.title: To deregister a container instance from a cluster

example.para: This example deregisters the first revision of the curler task definition

code.title: To deregister a revision of a task definition

example.para: This example retrieves details about all capacity providers.

code.title: To describe all capacity providers

example.para: This example retrieves details about the capacity provider MyCapacityProvider

code.title: To describe a specific capacity provider

example.para: This example provides a description of the specified cluster in your default region.

code.title: To describe a cluster

example.para: This example provides a description of the specified container instance in your default region, using the container instance UUID as an identifier.

code.title: To describe container instance

example.para: This example describes a service deployment for the service sd-example in the example cluster.

code.title: To describe a service deployment

example.para: This example describes a service revision with the specified ARN

code.title: To describe a service revision

example.para: This example provides descriptive information about the service named ``ecs-simple-service``.

code.title: To describe a service

example.para: This example provides a description of the specified task definition.

code.title: To describe a task definition

example.para: This example provides a description of the specified task, using the task UUID as an identifier.

code.title: To describe a task

example.para: This example describes a task set in service MyService that uses an EXTERNAL deployment controller.

code.title: To describe a task set

example.para: This example runs an interactive /bin/sh command on a container MyContainer.

code.title: To run a command remotely on a container in a task

example.para: In this example, we get the protection status for a single task.

code.title: To get the protection status of a task

example.para: This example displays the effective account settings for your account.

code.title: To view your effective account settings

example.para: This example displays the effective account settings for the specified user or role.

code.title: To view the effective account settings for a specific IAM user or IAM role

example.para: This example lists attributes for a container instance with the attribute "stack" equal to the value "production".

code.title: To list container instances that have a specific attribute

example.para: This example lists all of your available clusters in your default region.

code.title: To list your available clusters

example.para: This example lists all of your available container instances in the specified cluster in your default region.

code.title: To list your available container instances in a cluster

example.para: This example lists all successful service deployments for the service "sd-example" in the cluster "example".

code.title: To list service deployments that meet the specified criteria

example.para: This example lists the services running in the default cluster for an account.

code.title: To list the services in a cluster

example.para: This example lists the tags for the 'dev' cluster.

code.title: To list the tags for a cluster.

example.para: This example lists all of your registered task definition families.

code.title: To list your registered task definition families

example.para: This example lists the task definition revisions that start with "hpcc".

code.title: To filter your registered task definition families

example.para: This example lists all of your registered task definitions.

code.title: To list your registered task definitions

example.para: This example lists the task definition revisions of a specified family.

code.title: To list the registered task definitions in a family

example.para: This example lists all of the tasks in a cluster.

code.title: To list the tasks in a cluster

example.para: This example lists the tasks of a specified container instance. Specifying a ``containerInstance`` value limits the results to tasks that belong to that container instance.

code.title: To list the tasks on a particular container instance

example.para: This example modifies your account settings to opt in to the new ARN and resource ID format for Amazon ECS services. If you’re using this command as the root user, then changes apply to the entire AWS account, unless an IAM user or role explicitly overrides these settings for themselves.

code.title: To modify your account settings

example.para: This example modifies the account setting for a specific IAM user or IAM role to opt in to the new ARN and resource ID format for Amazon ECS container instances. If you’re using this command as the root user, then changes apply to the entire AWS account, unless an IAM user or role explicitly overrides these settings for themselves.

code.title: To modify the account settings for a specific IAM user or IAM role

example.para: This example modifies the default account setting for the specified resource for all IAM users or roles on an account. These changes apply to the entire AWS account, unless an IAM user or role explicitly overrides these settings for themselves.

code.title: To modify the default account settings for all IAM users or roles on an account

example.para: This example adds an attribute "stack" with the value "production" to a container instance.

code.title: To create or update an attribute on a resource

example.para: This example adds an existing capacity provider "MyCapacityProvider2" to a cluster that already has the capacity provider "MyCapacityProvider1" associated with it. Both "MyCapacityProvider2" and "MyCapacityProvider1" need to be specified.

code.title: To add an existing capacity provider to a cluuster

example.para: This example removes a capacity provider "MyCapacityProvider2" from a cluster that has both "MyCapacityProvider2" and "MyCapacityProvider1" associated with it. Only "MyCapacityProvider1" needs to be specified in this scenario.

code.title: To remove a capacity provider from a cluster

example.para: This example removes all capacity providers associated with a cluster.

code.title: To remove all capacity providers from a cluster

example.para: This example registers a task definition to the specified family.

code.title: To register a task definition

example.para: This example runs the specified task definition on your default cluster.

code.title: To run a task on your default cluster

example.para: This example starts a new task in the cluster "MyCluster" on the specified container instance using the latest revision of the "hello-world" task definition.

code.title: To start a new task

example.para: This example stops a task with ID "1dc5c17a-422b-4dc4-b493-371970c6c4d6" in cluster "MyCluster".

code.title: To stop a task

example.para: This example tags the 'dev' cluster with key 'team' and value 'dev'.

code.title: To tag a cluster.

example.para: This example deletes the 'team' tag from the 'dev' cluster.

code.title: To untag a cluster.

example.para: This example updates the targetCapacity and instanceWarmupPeriod parameters for the capacity provider MyCapacityProvider to 90 and 150 respectively.

code.title: To update a capacity provider's parameters

example.para: This example turns on enhanced containerInsights in an existing cluster.

code.title: To update a cluster's observability settings.

example.para: This example sets a default Service Connect namespace.

code.title: To update a cluster's Service Connect defaults.

example.para: This example enables CloudWatch Container Insights for the default cluster.

code.title: To update a cluster's settings

example.para: This example updates the container agent version on the specified container instance in cluster MyCluster.

code.title: To update the container agent version on a container instance

example.para: This example updates the state of the specified container instance in the default cluster to DRAINING.

code.title: To update the state of a container instance

example.para: This example updates the my-http-service service to use the amazon-ecs-sample task definition.

code.title: To change the task definition used in a service

example.para: This example updates the desired count of the my-http-service service to 10.

code.title: To change the number of tasks in a service

example.para: This example updates the primary task set for a service MyService that uses the EXTERNAL deployment controller type.

code.title: To update the primary task set for a service

example.para: This example enables scale-in protection for a task for 60 minutes.

code.title: To set task scale-in protection for a task for 60 minutes

example.para: This example enables task scale-in protection for a task, without specifying the expiresInMinutes parameter, for the default protection period of 120 minutes.

code.title: To set task scale-in protection for the default time period in minutes

example.para: This example removes scale-in protection for a task.

code.title: To remove task scale-in protection

example.para: This example updates the task set to adjust the scale.

code.title: To update a task set
